en: Your name is Jerry Grey and there is nothing, absolutely nothing, wrong with you except for the fact you can’t remember spraying a word you shouldn’t mention across the house of your neighbor. Here’s the thing. The shake. The rub.
zh: 你的名字是傑瑞·格雷，除了忘了在鄰居家的前牆上用油漆噴污言穢語，你沒有什麼不對勁的地方，絕對沒有。

en: The lowdown. Future Jerry, you don’t know for a fact you did what they think you did.
zh: 未來的傑瑞，你不知道你做了什麼，但他們認定是你做的。

en: Just because you hid a can of spray-paint in your office doesn’t mean you used a can of spray-paint on your neighbor’s house.
zh: 僅僅就因為你在寫作房裡藏了個噴漆罐並不意味著你在鄰居家的房子上噴過漆。

en: After all, there are kitchen knives in the kitchen, does that mean anybody stabbed over the last twenty years was stabbed by you?
zh: 廚房裡有把菜刀，難道就能證明二十年前你拿著它把人砍了？

en: The can is a holdover from days of Renovation Past, just as there are other paints stored in the garage.
zh: 那些油漆是「改造過去」時用剩下的，就跟存放在車庫裡的其他油漆一樣。

en: The plan after finding the spray-paint in the hiding spot had been to dump it. That much you remember. Toss it into a dumpster in town somewhere.
zh: 在暗室里發現噴漆后，你打算把它扔掉，這個你還記得，在城裡某處找個垃圾桶，把它扔掉。

en: The problem with that scenario is Sandra took the keys off you so you can’t drive anymore.
zh: 但問題在於桑德拉把車鑰匙拿走了，讓你開不了車。

en: She took them last night.
zh: 她是昨晚拿走的。

en: She said you may not realize it, but sadly you’re starting to slip a little.
zh: 她說她以為你不會察覺的，但可悲的是你還是發現了。

en: She said she’s taking them off you for your own safety, and for the safety of others on the roads.
zh: 她說她把鑰匙拿走是為了你的安全，為了其他路人的安全。

en: It hurt. But you know the truth, you know why she’s really taking them. It’s to control you.
zh: 這話很傷人，但是你知道她拿走鑰匙的真實目的是要控制你。

en: Don’t do this, Jerry. Don’t do that.
zh: 「傑瑞，不要這樣做；傑瑞，不要那樣做。」

en: It’s all you hear these days.
zh: 這些天你天天都聽到這些。

en: Jerry was confused. Jerry fucked up. Jerry is as mad as a hatter.
zh: 傑瑞迷迷糊糊的，傑瑞懵懵懂懂的，傑瑞瘋瘋癲癲的。

en: Thanks, Henry.
zh: 謝謝你，亨利。

en: Thankfully (and ain’t that going to be a word we’re going to look out for in the future?
zh: 幸運的是（這個詞語難道不是我們在將來苦苦等待的消息？

en: Thankfully it all worked out okay, thankfully you didn’t really have dementia) the woman who now rents that house you showed up at was a nurse at the Christchurch hospital, and she recognized that you were confused, you were scared, she could see who was really driving, and she took you inside and told you everything was going to be okay, she sat you down and made you a cup of tea.
zh: 「幸運的是」一切都變好了，「幸運的是」你並沒有患上老年痴呆症），現在租了那所房子的女人在是克萊斯特徹奇醫院的護士，她認為你被嚇壞了，變糊塗了，她能察覺現在是誰掌控著你。她讓你進來，告訴你一切都會好起來的。她請你坐下，給你沏了杯茶。

en: You asked why she was living in your house. She asked who you were, and you were . . . a little unsure, but you had your wallet, it had your driver’s license (Sandra in all her Let’s control Jerry wisdom at least didn’t take that off you), and once your name was out in the open you became Functioning Jerry, at least a little, and you told her where you lived.
zh: 你問她為什麼住在你的房子里，結果她問你是誰，你是……你有點兒不確定，但你帶著錢包，裏面有你的駕照（桑德拉只是想控制你，但她至少沒有把駕照拿走），你的名字終於水落石出了，現在你就成了正常的傑瑞，至少你能告訴她你住在哪兒。

en: She asked if you had your cell phone, and it turned out you did. She called Sandra at work.
zh: 她問你有沒有帶手機，你帶著，她便打電話給桑德拉。

en: Sandra said she was on her way.
zh: 桑德拉說她正在路上了。

en: In that time you were plied with biscuits to go along with the tea and a story of the neighborhood, including a murder that happened there a long time ago.
zh: 這段時間里，你一邊吃著點心、喝著茶，講述著之前鄰里之間的故事，包括很久以前發生在那裡的一樁謀殺案。

en: Did you remember that?
zh: 你還記得嗎？

en: No, what murder?
zh: 不記得了，什麼謀殺案？

en: It had happened twenty years ago, maybe even thirty, well before Mae (that was the nurse’s name—Nurse Mae) had moved onto the street.
zh: 這事發生在二十年前，也許是三十年前，在梅（這是那個護士的名字，梅護士）搬進這條街之前發生的。

en: In fact Mae had only been living in that house for six months. She was around your age, and you envied how sharp she was.
zh: 其實梅只在那所房子里住了六個月而已，她和你年齡相仿，但她仍舊思維敏捷，你好羡慕她。

en: You argued about it.
zh: 你爭辯起來。

en: Of course you did.
zh: 你當然會爭辯的。

en: You told her the truth, and the truth is you were throwing it out because you knew how it would look if you got found with it, even though it wasn’t the actual can used.
zh: 你告訴了她真相，真相就是你要把它扔掉，因為你知道如果它被發現會有什麼下場，哪怕它不是真正被用過的罐子。

en: She said you were throwing it out because you had done what Mrs. Smith had accused you of.
zh: 她說，你之所以要把它扔掉，是因為你做了史密斯太太控告你的事。

en: I knew it was you, she said, and she walked over to you, crouched in front of you so she could look you in the eyes, and put her hands on your knees.
zh: 「我知道是你。」她說著，向你走了過來，在你面前蹲下，看著你的眼睛，把手放在你的膝蓋上，「我不想相信，我想方設法地不去相信，但我知道是你做的。

en: Oh, Jerry, what are we going to do?
zh: 哦，傑瑞，我們該怎麼辦？

en: She shook her head. Of course not. But we have to do something.
zh: 她搖搖頭：「當然不會，但我們得做點什麼。

en: We can’t let Mrs. Smith pay for all that damage when we know you did it.
zh: 我們不能讓史密斯太太獨自承擔所有的損壞費用，因為我們知道是你做的。」

en: I didn’t do it.
zh: 「不是我做的。」

en: And we need to look at other options to make sure this doesn’t happen again.
zh: 「我們看看有沒有別的什麼辦法，能讓這種事不會再發生了。」

en: Like what?
zh: 「比如呢？」

en: She gave you a sad smile that told you there’s a lot of heartache and heartbreak on the way.
zh: 她對你憂傷地一笑，你知道她這笑容里包含了多少痛楚和心碎。

en: Let’s discuss it in the morning, she said.
zh: 「明天早上再說吧。」她說。

en: Tomorrow you’ll get to hear what those options are.
zh: 明天你會知道有什麼辦法的。

en: Good news?
zh: 好消息？

en: There isn’t really any good news today.
zh: 今天確實沒有什麼好消息。

en: Bad news? Your parents are dead.
zh: 壞消息：你的父母都死了。

en: You’ve known this for a while, since they died, actually, but it’s probably a good thing for you to know.
zh: 其實在他們去世多年以後，你剛剛得知此事。於你而言，這或許是件好事。

en: Dad drowned in the pool, and Mum got the Big C a few years later.
zh: 爸爸在游泳池裡溺死了，幾年後媽媽患上癌症。

en: That saying how you can never really go back home?
zh: 這是不是剛好說明你永遠也回不了家了呢？

en: It’s true, partner. Especially in your case.
zh: 這是真的，夥伴，尤其是在你現在面臨的情況下。

en: They take a fresh sample of his DNA, as if the previous sample could have been corrupted, even though Jerry knows the chances of that are even slimmer than him getting his old life back.
zh: 他們提取了他DNA的最新樣本，想是之前的樣本已經損壞。傑瑞知道這種概率微乎其微，比他找回以前記憶的概率還要小。

en: They wipe a cotton swab on the inside of his cheek and he feels like a character in one of his novels, the one where the innocent man is accused of murder and his protests just make him look guiltier.
zh: 他們用棉簽擦拭他的口腔壁，就像他小說中一個無辜的角色一般，被指控謀殺，他的抗辯只會反襯得他更有嫌疑。

en: He’s not asked any more questions because his answers can’t be considered relevant.
zh: 他們沒有問他任何問題，因為他的回答都會被視為與案件無關。

en: Nothing he says, according to his lawyer, is relevant.
zh: 他的律師表示，他所說的一切都與案件無關。

en: This is who he is now, he thinks. Irrelevant Jerry.
zh: 他認為現在坐在那裡的是一個與傑瑞毫不相關的人。

en: Nurse Hamilton comes close to having to be restrained when she sees the mark on his face. The detective whose fingers he broke is nowhere to be seen.
zh: 漢密爾頓護士看到他臉上的傷痕，探過身子想看仔細些，但被制止了。

en: Nurse Hamilton sits in the interrogation room with Jerry, the two of them alone while others outside discuss his future.
zh: 漢密爾頓護士與傑瑞坐在審訊室里，其他人則在外面討論著他的未來。

en: “It’s going to be okay,” she says, and she squeezes his hand and they stay that way, waiting to see what happens next.
zh: 「會沒事的。」她說著，緊握著他的手。他們就保持著這個姿勢，看看接下來會發生什麼。

en: What happens next is Jerry’s lawyer enters the room and tells them they’re free to go, and that tomorrow, under his supervision, Jerry will be interviewed by a specialist.
zh: 接下來，傑瑞的律師走進房間，告訴他們傑瑞已經自由了，可以離開這裏。在他的監督下，傑瑞明天將會接受專家約談。

en: The detective whose fingers he didn’t break escorts them downstairs without a word.
zh: 沒有被折斷手指的那個警察一聲不吭地陪同他們下樓。

en: Nurse Hamilton is parked a block away, and the detective walks with them to the car.
zh: 漢密爾頓護士的車停在幾條街道之外，警察陪同他們走了過去。

en: Jerry climbs in and the detective and Nurse Hamilton chat for a few seconds and he wonders what they’re saying and figures it can’t be anything positive.
zh: 傑瑞上了車，警察和漢密爾頓護士在外面聊了幾秒鐘，他心裏納悶不知道他們會說什麼，但肯定不是什麼好事。

en: “Do you really think I hurt that woman?”
zh: 「你真的認為我殺害了那個女人？」

en: he asks her a minute later.
zh: 一分鐘后他問。

en: They’re at a set of lights that are green, but traffic is at a standstill thanks to a family of ducks up ahead crossing the road.
zh: 綠燈在前面亮著，但交通仍處於停滯狀態，因為前方正有一群鴨子在過馬路。

en: Eva used to love seeing sights like that when she was a kid. She’d pin her face and hands to the window and talk to them as they wandered past.
zh: 伊娃小的時候很喜歡看這幅景象，她會把臉和手貼在車窗上和它們說話，等著它們過去。

en: “Honestly, Jerry? I don’t know. I just don’t know.”
zh: 「說實話，傑瑞，我不知道，我真不知道。」

en: “Then why aren’t you afraid of me?”
zh: 「那你為什麼不怕我？」

en: “Look at me, Jerry. Do I look like I’ve ever been afraid of anyone?”
zh: 「看著我，傑瑞，難道我像是怕過誰的人嗎？」

en: The ducks clear the road, heading away from the direction of a park and towards a fish-and-chip shop, making Jerry picture a scenario where the ducks are ordering dinner, and a different scenario where they’re becoming dinner.
zh: 浩浩蕩蕩的鴨子從公園朝著炸魚薯條店的方向走了過去，傑瑞腦海閃現出了這樣一幅畫面：鴨子們在排隊訂餐，另一幅畫面則是它們變成了晚餐。

en: “I wish I could remember back then,” he says.
zh: 「我真希望我還能記得當時的情形。」

en: “I used to keep a journal. Where is it?”
zh: 他說，「我以前寫過日記，它在哪裡？」

en: “Nobody knows what happened to it.”
zh: 「沒人知道它在哪兒。」

en: “You mean it’s not at the home?”
zh: 「你的意思是它不在家裡？」

en: “Nobody found it. Not even the police.
zh: 「沒有人發現它，甚至連警察也沒有。

en: You must have hidden it somewhere.”
zh: 你一定是藏在什麼地方了。」

en: “Maybe,” he says.
zh: 「也許吧。」他說。

en: “It was sold.”
zh: 「賣了。」

en: “There are people living in there now?”
zh: 「現在有人住嗎？」

en: “I assume so. Why?”
zh: 「我猜是的，怎麼了？」

en: “Because there was a place in my office where I used to hide things,” he says, nodding now, the image clear.
zh: 「因為我的寫作房裡有個地方，我以前用來藏東西的。」他說著擺了擺頭，記憶更清晰了，「也許我們可以去那兒看看，日記肯定在那裡。」

en: “I’m sure the hiding place was found by the new owners,” she says.
zh: 「我敢肯定那個暗格已經被新業主發現了。」她說。

en: He shakes his head. “If the police couldn’t find it, the new owners wouldn’t have either.”
zh: 他搖搖頭：「如果連警方找不到，新業主也不會找到。」

en: “The police probably didn’t know they were looking for it,” she says.
zh: 「警方可能根本不知道他們在找它。」

en: “But you haven’t mentioned this before.”
zh: 她說，「不過你以前沒有提到過這事。」

en: He wonders why that could be. Perhaps he didn’t mention it before because he didn’t want to know. Perhaps enough of him remembered that it was best he forget. Only now he needs to know.
zh: 他不明白這是為什麼，也許他之前沒有提到它是因為他不想知道，或者他覺得記住還不如忘了，只是現在他需要知道了。

en: “It was under the floor. If we find it, it might tell us what happened.”
zh: 「在地板下面，如果我們找到了它，它會告訴我們發生了什麼事的。」

en: “I don’t know, Jerry.”
zh: 「我不知道，傑瑞。」

en: “Please?”
zh: 「拜託！」

en: “Even if it is there you might not like what you find.
zh: 「就算找到了，你也可能不會喜歡日記里的內容。

en: I don’t want this to sound mean, but perhaps it’s best you leave it alone.
zh: 我不希望讓它聽起來不懷好意，但你最好不要管。

en: We should just call the police and let them handle it.”
zh: 我們應該報警，讓警方去處理。」

en: “What if I didn’t shoot her?”
zh: 「要是不是我開槍打死她的呢？」

en: “Is that what you think?”
zh: 「你是這樣想的？」

en: He throws his hands up.
zh: 他攤開雙手。

en: “There’s one big plot hole in all of this,” he says.
zh: 「這裏面有個巨大的漏洞。」

en: “If I’m going to start confessing to crimes, why the fictional ones? Why not the real ones?
zh: 他說，「要是我一開始就承認了罪行，而為什麼我坦承的卻是虛構的罪行而不是真實的罪行呢？

en: I think it’d be the other way around.”
zh: 我覺得裏面肯定有問題。」

en: She doesn’t have an answer for that.
zh: 她沒有回答。

en: “What if the journal clears me?
zh: 「要是日記可以證明我無罪呢？

en: Please, when was the last time I was like this?”
zh: 求求你了。我上次像這樣是什麼時候？」

en: “Like what?” “So aware. So me. This Jerry right now, he wants to know what happened.
zh: 「像此刻這麼清醒，此刻的我就是真正的傑瑞，我想知道發生了什麼。

en: He’s hopeful he’s not the monster you all think he is.”
zh: 我希望大家不要把我看作怪物。」

en: “I don’t think you’re a monster,” she says.
zh: 「我不認為你是怪物。」

en: “And to answer your question, it’s been a while since you were this clearheaded. A few months at least.”
zh: 她說，「現在我來回答你的問題，你像現在這樣頭腦清醒已經有一段時間了，至少有幾個月了。」

en: “My daughter thinks I’m a monster,” he says, and it’s all making sense now.
zh: 「我女兒認為我是個怪物。」

en: The distance between them. “That’s why she never comes to visit. She hates me.”
zh: 他說，一切都明了了，可以解釋他們倆之間的隔閡，「這就是她從來不來看我的原因，她恨我。」

en: “She doesn’t hate you,” Nurse Hamilton says.
zh: 「她不恨你。」漢密爾頓護士說。

en: “She doesn’t even call me Dad anymore.”
zh: 「她甚至都不叫我爸爸了。」

en: “It’s hard for her.”
zh: 「她也很為難的。」

en: “I need the journal.
zh: 「我需要日記，需要知道真相。」

en: She thinks about it quietly. He can see her going through the options.
zh: 她靜靜地想著，他能看得出她正在抉擇。

en: He wants to add more, but he’s frightened anything else may push her back from the decision he needs her to make.
zh: 他想再說什麼，但又怕會讓她放棄他希望她所做出的決定。

en: “Okay,” she says, and then she pulls out of the flow of traffic to the side of the road to a stop.
zh: 「好吧。」說著，她駛離車流，把車開到路邊停下，「我先打電話給你的律師。

en: “Let me call your lawyer first. I want to clear it by him, and I want to make sure I’m not doing anything illegal.”
zh: 我想找他確認一下，保證我沒有做任何違法的事。」

en: “I’ll be okay, I promise.”
zh: 「我會配合的，我保證。」

en: “Don’t get your hopes up, Jerry.
zh: 「別抱太大的希望，傑瑞。

en: There may not be anybody home, and even if there is we don’t know they’re going to let us in, and even then the journal may not be there.”
zh: 家裡可能沒有人，即使有，我們也不知道他們會不會讓我們進去，我們甚至不知道日記是否還在那兒。」

en: “I know. I know.”
zh: 「我知道，我知道。」

en: “And if we do find it, the police will want it.
zh: 「如果我們真的找到了，警察也會需要的。

en: They may consider it as evidence. They may not give it back to you.”
zh: 他們會認為這是證據，可能不會還給你。」

en: “I just need to read it. That’s all.”
zh: 「我只是想讀讀，就這樣。」

en: “Are you sure about this?
zh: 「你確定嗎？

en: I mean really sure?”
zh: 我是說，你真的確定嗎？」

en: “I’m sure,” he says.
zh: 「我確定。」他說，然後又補充說，「我會好好的。」

en: “This is the house where Sandra died, Jerry, and you may be about to read your own account of being her killer.
zh: 「桑德拉就死在這座房子里，傑瑞，你可能會讀到親手殺死她的陳述。

en: I’m going to call Eric to come and help us because I think there’s a very good chance that okay may be the last thing you’re going to be.”
zh: 我得叫艾瑞克來幫忙，因為我覺得這可能是讓你走上正軌的絕佳機會。」
